org.fhnw.aigs.server.gameHandling

Class User

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fhnw.aigs.server.gameHandling.User

  • public class User
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for all User related tasks. It loads generates user files, loads users, logs them on and off.
    v1.0 Initial release
    v1.1 Major changes in handling
    v1.1.1 Bugfixes
    v1.2 Changing of logging
    Version:
    1.2 (Raphael Stoeckli, 24.02.2015)
    Author:
    Matthias St√∂ckli

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  User.UserList
      This construct is storing users - it was created for XML-parsing purposes and is just a wrapper for an ArrayList which is not natively supported by JAXB without modifications.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean aiUser
      Indicates whether the user is a AI.

      Indicates whether the user is a regular (known) user or an anonymos (adHoc created) user.

    • Field Detail

      • userCount

        public static long userCount
        A number used to generate unique user IDs. Will not be marshalled.

      • users

        public static User.UserList users
        A list of all current users. Will not be marshalled.
        Do not use add and remove methods directly on this list.
        Use instead addUserToUserList(org.fhnw.aigs.server.gameHandling.User) and removeUserFromUserList(org.fhnw.aigs.server.gameHandling.User).

      • id

        private long id
        The user's unique ID.

      • userName

        private java.lang.String userName
        The user's name.

      • identificationCode

        private java.lang.String identificationCode
        The user's "password" or identification code.

      • loggedIn

        private boolean loggedIn
        A flag that indicates whether or not a user is online.

      • anonymousUser

        private boolean anonymousUser
        Indicates whether the user is a regular (known) user or an anonymos (adHoc created) user.
        Will not be marshalled because adHoc users are not stored
        See also writeUsersToXml() about the handling of non-persistent users
        Since:
        v1.1

      • doppelganger

        private boolean doppelganger
        Indicates whether the user is a copy of an already logged in user.
        Will not be marshalled because doppelgangers are not stored
        See also writeUsersToXml() about the handling of non-persistent users
        Since:
        v1.1

      • aiUser

        private boolean aiUser
        Indicates whether the user is a AI. This parameter is optional. Use it if you want to show an AI user in the server GUI.
        Will not be marshalled because AIs are not stored
        See also writeUsersToXml() about the handling of non-persistent users
        Since:
        v1.1

      • removeAllNonPersistentUsers

        public static void removeAllNonPersistentUsers()
        Removes all non persistent users (anonymous/AdHoc and doppelganger) from the static user list
        Since:
        v1.1

      • isNonPersistentUser

        public boolean isNonPersistentUser()
        Method checks whether the user is non persistent:
        • Anonymous user (AdHoc)
        • Doppelganger
        • AI User
        Returns:
        True if the user is non-persistent, otherwise false

      • generateRandomPassword

        private static java.lang.String generateRandomPassword(int length)
        Generates a password or identification code based on the specified length. It consists of alphebetic values (a-Z).
        Parameters:
        length - The length of the password
        Returns:
        A random password.

      • readUsersFromPlainText

        private static void readUsersFromPlainText()
                                    throws java.io.IOException,
                                           javax.xml.bind.JAXBException
        Deprecated. Do not use thes method anymore. Use XML serialization (readUsersFromXml()) instead
        Reads the file "conf/users.txt" and generates a new usersXml file. The document should be plaintext. Every line is equals to one user.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown when the file could not be read.
        javax.xml.bind.JAXBException - Thrown when the users could not be serialized.

      • identify

        public static org.fhnw.aigs.commons.communication.IdentificationResponseMessage identify(java.lang.String userName,
                                                                                         java.lang.String password,
                                                                                         java.lang.String playerName,
                                                                                         boolean isMultiLoginAllowed)
        Handles the user login. If anonymous login is allowed, an Ad-hoc user will be created. If multiple logins are allowed, a doppelganger will be created.
        Parameters:
        userName - The user (login) name to be checked.
        playerName - The users' displayed name
        password - The user's password/identification code.
        isMultiLoginAllowed - Flag that indicates whether the configuration
        Returns:
        A IdentificationResponseMessage which is sent back to the client.
        Since:
        v1.1

      • getUnusedUsername

        private static java.lang.String getUnusedUsername(java.lang.String template)
        Returns an unused user name. This method is importatnt for anonymous login (Ad-hoc users)
        Parameters:
        template - The initial username to check
        Returns:
        A currently not used user name
        Since:
        v1.1

      • checkCredentials

        private static org.fhnw.aigs.commons.communication.IdentificationResponseMessage checkCredentials(java.lang.String userName,
                                                                                                  java.lang.String identificationCode,
                                                                                                  boolean isMultiLoginAllowed)
        Checks whether a login attempt was successful of not and generates a IdentificiationResponseMessage based on the result.
        Parameters:
        userName - The user name to be checked.
        identificationCode - The user's password/identification code.
        isMultiLoginAllowed - Flag that indicates whether the configuration option ServerConfiguration.isMultiLoginAllowed is set to true or the server is running on localhost.
        Returns:
        A IdentificationResponseMessage which is sent back to the client.
        Since:
        v1.1 [was originally method identify(...)]

      • logOffUserByName

        public static void logOffUserByName(java.lang.String name)
        Remove a player from the list of active players/users. The user will not be removed from the static user list. Use method removeUserFromUserList(org.fhnw.aigs.server.gameHandling.User) if a user must be removed from the static user list.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the player to be logged off.

      • readUsersFromXml

        public static User.UserList readUsersFromXml()
        Returns a list of stored users from the file conf/usersXml.xml
        Returns:
        List of registred users

      • writeUsersToXml

        public static void writeUsersToXml()
        Saves the static user list to the file conf/usersXml.xml
        Since:
        v1.1

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        javax.xml.bind.JAXBException
        Deprecated. Do not use this method. Use the visual user management tool from she Server GUI instead
        Reads users from a text file and writes it to an xml file.
        Parameters:
        args - No need for that.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        javax.xml.bind.JAXBException

      • generateDoppelganger

        public static User generateDoppelganger(User loggedInUser)
        Generates a new user based on another user in the case multi login is allowed.
        Parameters:
        loggedInUser - The "original" user.
        Returns:
        The "doppelganger".
